snippet.title: Costa Rica is demanding US explain 'Cuban Twitter'
snippet.description: The Costa Rican government says it's waiting for the Obama administration to explain why it improperly devised a secret "Cuban Twitter" network from inside the Central American nation's borders despite warnings in 2009 that the plan could jeopardize the two countries' diplomatic relations.

snippet.title: China set to punish web giant Sina for pornography
snippet.description: China plans to revoke two crucial publication licenses for Sina.com, which might partially ban the web giant's operations, because obscene content was found during an anti-pornography crackdown, state media said Thursday.

snippet.title: In Disney's shadow, homeless families struggle
snippet.description: When they moved from Georgia to the theme park playground of central Florida four years ago, Anthony and Candice Johnson found work at a barbecue restaurant and a 7-Eleven. Their combined salaries nevertheless fell short of what they needed to rent an apartment, so the couple and their two children have instead been hopping among cheap motel rooms along U.S. 192.

snippet.title: Ukraine's prime minister: 'You have to do everything all at once'
snippet.description: Ukraine's prime minister sits down with The Post's Lally Weymouth

snippet.title: Facebook 1Q earnings soar; CFO to step down
snippet.description: Facebook's 1st-quarter soar to surpass expectations, CFO to step down

snippet.title: AP News in Brief at 10:58 p.m. EDT
snippet.description: Syrian activists, medics accuse Assad government of chlorine gas attacks; Syria denies it

snippet.title: Arlington and Alexandria volunteer opportunities
snippet.description: Volunteer advocates, teachers, office administrator, foster puppy raisers and gardeners are needed.

snippet.title: New social networks connect cooks and diners
snippet.description: If the latest development in culinary social media catches on, the trendiest restaurants may no longer be restaurants.

snippet.title: Facebook 1Q results soar; CFO to step down
snippet.description: Facebook's earnings nearly tripled and revenue grew sharply in the first quarter, surpassing Wall Street's expectations thanks to an 82 percent increase in advertising revenue.
